      • mineGoodPatterns

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> mineGoodPatterns(java.util.List<java.lang.String> seedComparatorPairs,

      • generateLexicalPatterns

        private static java.util.List<java.lang.String> generateLexicalPatterns(java.util.List<java.lang.String> questions)
        Lexical patterns indicate sequential patterns consisting of only words and symbols ($C, #start, and "#end"). They are generated by suffix tree algorithm with two constraints: A patterns should contain more than one $C and its frequency in collection should be more than an empirically determined number beta.
        Parameters:
        questions - The set of questions to generate patterns from
        Returns:
        A set of lexical patterns

      • generateGeneralizedPatterns

        private static java.util.List<java.lang.String> generateGeneralizedPatterns(java.util.List<java.lang.String> patterns)
        A lexical pattern can be too specific. Thus, we generalize lexical patterns by replacing one or more words/phrases with their POS tags. 2^(n-1) generalized patterns can be produced from a lexical pattern containing N words excluding $Cs.
        Parameters:
        patterns - A lexical pattern from which generalized patterns can be generated
        Returns:
        A set of generalized patterns

      • generateSpecializedPatterns

        private static java.util.List<java.lang.String> generateSpecializedPatterns(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lexicalPatterns,
                                                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> generalPatterns)
        In some cases, a pattern can be too general. For example, although, a question "ipod or zune" is comparative, the pattern "<$C or $C> is too general, and there can be many noncomparative questions matching the pattern, for instance "true or false?". Fir this reason, we perform pattern specialization by adding POS tags to all comparator slots. For example, from the lexical pattern, "<$C or $C>" and the question "ipod or zune", "<$C/NN or $C/NN> will be produced as a specialized pattern.
        Parameters:
        lexicalPatterns - The lexical patterns to be specialized
        generalPatterns - The general patterns to be generalized
        Returns:
        A set of specialized items generated from lexical and general patterns.

      • combinations

        private static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> combinations(java.util.List<java.lang.String> question,
                                                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> pos)
        Generates all combinations where each element from question is replaced with the corresponding element from pos.
        Parameters:
        question - Contains the item to be replaced
        pos - Contains the POS tags to replace the items
        Returns:
        Lists containing all possible combinations with question items replaced with pos.
